p: Model 2 was our baseline model because it reflects the course of outbreaks and variation therein, according to our best estimate. The estimates of κ L , ρ L , κ I and ρ I included in the above-mentioned models came from dataset A (i.e., PCR results) because we selected PCR as our default analysis, given its higher sensitivity. To investigate the role of the virus detection assay as a further source of uncertainty, a fourth set of 1,000 simulations was performed applying model 2 to dataset B (i.e., virus isolation results).
